Class Population

java.lang.Object
  Population

public class Population
extends java.lang.Object

The population class stores the population maps for pumas and hares.

Version:
(a version number or a date)
Author:
(your name)

Constructor Summary
Population(GridMap map)
          This constructor creates a new object that is attached to a GridMap object that shows the geography of the map.
 
Method Summary
 double getAdjHarePops(int row1, int column1)
          This method returns the combined hare populations of all the squares adjacent to a given square.
 double getAdjPumaPops(int row1, int column1)
          This method returns the combined puma populations of all the squares adjacent to a given square.
 int getCol(int ncol)
          This method returns the column of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.
 double getHarePop(int row, int column)
          This method returns the hare population of a given square, but only the data structure coordinates can be used as inputs,
 double getPumaPop(int row, int column)
          This method returns the puma population of a given square, but only the data structure coordinates can be used as inputs.
 int getRow(int nrow)
          This method returns the row of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.
 java.lang.String toString()
          This method prints out a graphical representation of the two population maps.

Constructor Detail

Population

public Population(GridMap map)
This constructor creates a new object that is attached to a GridMap object that shows the geography of the map.

Parameters:
map - The GridMap object representing the map of the area.
Method Detail

getAdjHarePops

public double getAdjHarePops(int row1,
                             int column1)
This method returns the combined hare populations of all the squares adjacent to a given square.

Parameters:
row1 - The row of the given square.
column1 - The column of the given square.
Returns:
The sum of the adjacent squares' hare populations.

getAdjPumaPops

public double getAdjPumaPops(int row1,
                             int column1)
This method returns the combined puma populations of all the squares adjacent to a given square.

Parameters:
row1 - The row of the given square.
column1 - The column of the given square.
Returns:
The sum of the adjacent squares' puma populations.

getCol

public int getCol(int ncol)
This method returns the column of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.

Parameters:
ncol - The row of the element in the map.

getHarePop

public double getHarePop(int row,
                         int column)
This method returns the hare population of a given square, but only the data structure coordinates can be used as inputs,

Parameters:
row - The row.
column - The column.
Returns:
The hare population of the square.

getPumaPop

public double getPumaPop(int row,
                         int column)
This method returns the puma population of a given square, but only the data structure coordinates can be used as inputs.

Parameters:
row - The row.
column - The column.
Returns:
The puma population of the square.

getRow

public int getRow(int nrow)
This method returns the row of the element as it is stored in the 2D array; because the map can't be stored in the program like it is represented in the model the coordinates in the data structure will be different from those in the map.

Parameters:
nrow - The row of the element in the map.
